required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Leptin Levels in Papillary Thyroid Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Serum Leptin Levels in Females With Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma, Benign Thyroid Nodules, and Normal Controls

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate Leptin levels in females, in the setting of papillary thyroid cancer, benign thyroid nodules, and in normal females without thyroid disease.

detailed_description.textblock: There will be three groups in this study, but 2 of the groups are part of another study so will only recruit normal controls.

primary_outcome.measure: evaluating Leptin level Evaluating Serum Leptin Levels Between 3 Groups. One Group with Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma. One Group With Benign Nodules. One Group with Normal Thyroid.
primary_outcome.description: Assessing serum leptin levels in females with treated papillary thyroid carcinoma and compared to females with proven benign thyroid nodules and females with normal thyroid glands. All groups were matched by gender, age, and BMI to limit confounders.

study_pop.textblock:
Females with no prior history of thyroid disease and not on thyroid medications.
Active recruitment will be for normal controls only. They will be age and weight/height matched to females with prior diagnosis of thyroid cancer or thyroid nodules who are already part of another study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- Age>/- 19
- Not currently pregnant or lactating
- Normal thyroid gland by history
Exclusion Criteria:
- Male Gender
- Pregnancy
- Lactation
- Age below 19
- Abnormal thyroid gland by history
- Abnormal thyroid gland by structure using ultrasound
- Abnormal thyroid gland by function using TSH, Free T4
